description: From Latin asinīnus (“of a donkey or ass”).

adjectives.description: asinine (comparative more asinine, superlative most asinine)

entries.meaning: Very foolish; failing to exercise intelligence or judgement or rationality.
Of, pertaining to, or characteristic of donkeys.
examples: Don Quixote had put himself but a little way ayont the village of Don Diego, when he encountered two apparent priests, or students, and two husbandmen, who came mounted on four asinine beasts.
